parameters.text:
=Based on the following keyword, provide me ranking of the 1st 5 website.
keyword: {{ $json.keyword }}

parameters.content:
## 🟦 **Section 1: Input & Trigger Configuration**

### 🕒 **Trigger: Run Daily/Weekly**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Trigger: Run Daily/Weekly`
💡 **What it does:**
This node automatically starts your workflow on a set schedule. You can run it:

* Daily to monitor SEO fluctuations
* Weekly to track long-term trends

📌 **Why it's useful:**
No manual work is needed. Just set it once and it keeps your ranking logs up to date.

---

### 📝 **Input: Keyword & Domain**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Input: Keyword & Domain`
💡 **What it does:**
Here you provide the **search keyword** (like `"best running shoes"`) and optionally the **domain name** (like `"yourwebsite.com"`) to monitor.

📌 **Why it's useful:**
You can change or extend keywords anytime without changing the rest of the workflow. Great for campaign flexibility.

---

## 🟨 **Section 2: Smart SERP Scraping with AI Agent**

### 🤖 **SERP Scraper Agent (MCP)**

🔧 **Node Name:** `SERP Scraper Agent (MCP)`
💡 **What it does:**
This is your smart agent that uses **Bright Data's MCP (Mobile Carrier Proxy)** to simulate real user behavior and scrape **Google Search Results** accurately.

It connects to:

#### 🧠 **AI Brain**

🔧 **Sub-node:** `OpenAI Chat Model`
🎯 Understands the keyword, crafts a natural query prompt, and makes sure the search context is accurate.

#### 🌐 **MCP SERP Fetcher**

🔧 **Sub-node:** `MCP Client`
🛰️ Actually performs the search on Google and fetches the **top 5 results** anonymously through real mobile-like connections (bypassing CAPTCHAs & blocks).

#### 🧾 **SERP Output Formatter**

🔧 **Sub-node:** `Structured Output Parser`
🧹 Cleans up the scraped data and structures it into useful fields:

* `rank`
* `title`
* `url`
* `description`

📌 **Why it's useful:**
Traditional scrapers break often. This smart setup ensures highly accurate, undetectable scraping that adapts to changes in search results.

---

## 🟩 **Section 3: Rank Logging and Reporting**

### 🧠 **Parse SERP Results**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Parse SERP Results`
💡 **What it does:**
This **Code node** takes the structured list of top 5 results and **splits them into individual records**, one per website.

📌 **Why it's useful:**
It prepares the data so each row can be logged separately in your spreadsheet, which makes filtering, charting, and comparison super easy.

---

### 📊 **Log to Google Sheets**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Log to Google Sheets`
💡 **What it does:**
Appends each parsed search result (rank, title, URL, description) into your tracking spreadsheet.

=======================================

## 🔍 **Workflow: Monitor Keyword Rankings with AI & Bright Data MCP**

Track where your website ranks on Google for specific keywords, using AI-powered scraping and structured logging in Google Sheets.

---

## 🟦 **Section 1: Input & Trigger Configuration**

### 🕒 **Trigger: Run Daily/Weekly**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Trigger: Run Daily/Weekly`
💡 **What it does:**
This node automatically starts your workflow on a set schedule. You can run it:

* Daily to monitor SEO fluctuations
* Weekly to track long-term trends

📌 **Why it's useful:**
No manual work is needed. Just set it once and it keeps your ranking logs up to date.

---

### 📝 **Input: Keyword & Domain**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Input: Keyword & Domain`
💡 **What it does:**
Here you provide the **search keyword** (like `"best running shoes"`) and optionally the **domain name** (like `"yourwebsite.com"`) to monitor.

📌 **Why it's useful:**
You can change or extend keywords anytime without changing the rest of the workflow. Great for campaign flexibility.

---

## 🟨 **Section 2: Smart SERP Scraping with AI Agent**

### 🤖 **SERP Scraper Agent (MCP)**

🔧 **Node Name:** `SERP Scraper Agent (MCP)`
💡 **What it does:**
This is your smart agent that uses **Bright Data's MCP (Mobile Carrier Proxy)** to simulate real user behavior and scrape **Google Search Results** accurately.

It connects to:

#### 🧠 **AI Brain**

🔧 **Sub-node:** `OpenAI Chat Model`
🎯 Understands the keyword, crafts a natural query prompt, and makes sure the search context is accurate.

#### 🌐 **MCP SERP Fetcher**

🔧 **Sub-node:** `MCP Client`
🛰️ Actually performs the search on Google and fetches the **top 5 results** anonymously through real mobile-like connections (bypassing CAPTCHAs & blocks).

#### 🧾 **SERP Output Formatter**

🔧 **Sub-node:** `Structured Output Parser`
🧹 Cleans up the scraped data and structures it into useful fields:

* `rank`
* `title`
* `url`
* `description`

📌 **Why it's useful:**
Traditional scrapers break often. This smart setup ensures highly accurate, undetectable scraping that adapts to changes in search results.

---

## 🟩 **Section 3: Rank Logging and Reporting**

### 🧠 **Parse SERP Results**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Parse SERP Results`
💡 **What it does:**
This **Code node** takes the structured list of top 5 results and **splits them into individual records**, one per website.

📌 **Why it's useful:**
It prepares the data so each row can be logged separately in your spreadsheet, which makes filtering, charting, and comparison super easy.

---

### 📊 **Log to Google Sheets**

🔧 **Node Name:** `Log to Google Sheets`
💡 **What it does:**
Appends each parsed search result (rank, title, URL, description) into your tracking spreadsheet.

📌 **Why it's useful:**
You now have a full historical record of how rankings change day by day, week by week. This is great for:

* SEO audits
* Campaign reporting
* Alerting when a competitor outranks you

---
